newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - May 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - May 21.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said present number of 700 cyclone shelters in the coastal areas was indaequate and "we need at least 2,000 shelters."
The Indian government is actively considering narrowing down Bangladesh's huge trade gap with India, acting Indian High Commissioner Parbati Sen Vyas said.
The Foreign Ministry has decided to launch an initiative to help implement the privatisation policy of the government through disseminating information among prospective buyers in foreign countries.
A Foreign Ministry meeting has decided to send a detailed report on the death and devastation caused by the cyclone as well as disaster management to Bangladesh missions abroad.
The death toll from Monday's severe cyclone has so far reached about 250. Reports of casualties are pouring in as the telephopne and wireless communications are being restored with remote areas.
Opposition leader and chairperson of Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has asked her partymen to stand by the disressed people following Monday's cyclone.
The Chittagong Port incurred a loss of seven million taka due to damage caused by the severe cyclonic storm that lashed the coastal districts.

Privatisation Board chairman Kazi Zafarullah on Tuesday announced that the board which has failed to privatise a single state-owned unit in the last 10 and half months would divest eight to 10 units during the next one and half month of the current fiscal year.
